fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.themes

Enum StyleMediaFeature

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<StyleMediaFeature>
      • fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.themes.StyleMediaFeature
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<StyleMediaFeature>

    public enum StyleMediaFeature
extends Enum<StyleMediaFeature>
    Enumeration of W3 CSS3 media features, for creating media queries with visual theme CSS style sheets. This capability helps build responsive design HTML5 front office layouts.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    StyleMediaType, toFeature(), IThemedDesign.addStyleSheet(IStyleSheet, CharSequence)

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      aspectRatio
      Defined as the ratio of the value of the "width" media feature to the value of the "height" media feature.
      color
      Describes the number of bits per color component of the output device.
      colorIndex
      Describes the number of entries in the color lookup table of the output device.
      deviceAspectRatio
      Defined as the ratio of the value of the "device-width" media feature to the value of the "device-height" media feature.
      deviceHeight
      Describes the height of the rendering surface of the output device.
      deviceWidth
      Describes the width of the rendering surface of the output device.
      grid
      Determines whether the output device is grid or bitmap.
      height
      Describes the height of the targeted display area of the output device.
      monochrome
      Describes the number of bits per pixel in a monochrome frame buffer.
      orientation
      Defined as "portrait" when the value of the "height" media feature is greater than or equal to the value of the "width" media feature.
      resolution
      Describes the resolution of the output device (pixel density).
      scan
      Describes the scanning process of "tv" output devices.
      width
      Describes the width of the targeted display area of the output device.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • width

        public static final StyleMediaFeature width
        Describes the width of the targeted display area of the output device. Value is a non-negative length.

      • height

        public static final StyleMediaFeature height
        Describes the height of the targeted display area of the output device. Value is a non-negative length.

      • deviceWidth

        public static final StyleMediaFeature deviceWidth
        Describes the width of the rendering surface of the output device. Value is a non-negative length.

      • deviceHeight

        public static final StyleMediaFeature deviceHeight
        Describes the height of the rendering surface of the output device. Value is a non-negative length.

      • orientation

        public static final StyleMediaFeature orientation
        Defined as "portrait" when the value of the "height" media feature is greater than or equal to the value of the "width" media feature. Otherwise "orientation" is "landscape".

      • aspectRatio

        public static final StyleMediaFeature aspectRatio
        Defined as the ratio of the value of the "width" media feature to the value of the "height" media feature. Value is a ratio, such as "16/9".

      • deviceAspectRatio

        public static final StyleMediaFeature deviceAspectRatio
        Defined as the ratio of the value of the "device-width" media feature to the value of the "device-height" media feature. Value is a ratio, such as "16/9".

      • color

        public static final StyleMediaFeature color
        Describes the number of bits per color component of the output device. If the device is not a color device, the value is zero. If different color components are represented by different number of bits, the smallest number is used. In a device with indexed colors, the minimum number of bits per color component in the lookup table is used. Value is a non-negative integer.

      • colorIndex

        public static final StyleMediaFeature colorIndex
        Describes the number of entries in the color lookup table of the output device. If the device does not use a color lookup table, the value is zero. Value is a non-negative integer.

      • monochrome

        public static final StyleMediaFeature monochrome
        Describes the number of bits per pixel in a monochrome frame buffer. If the device is not a monochrome device, the output device value will be 0 Value is a non-negative integer.

      • resolution

        public static final StyleMediaFeature resolution
        Describes the resolution of the output device (pixel density). For printers, this corresponds to the screening resolution (the resolution for printing dots of arbitrary color). Value is a non-negative resolution, such as "326dpi" (dots per inch) or "100dpcm" (dots per centimeter).

      • scan

        public static final StyleMediaFeature scan
        Describes the scanning process of "tv" output devices. Value can be "progressive" or "interlace".

      • grid

        public static final StyleMediaFeature grid
        Determines whether the output device is grid or bitmap. If the output device is grid-based (e.g., a "tty" terminal, or a phone display with only one fixed font), the value will be 1. Otherwise, the value will be 0.

        Media feature "minimum" prefix.
        Since:

      • values

        public static StyleMediaFeature[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (StyleMediaFeature c : StyleMediaFeature.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static StyleMediaFeature valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • toFeature

        public String toFeature()
        Gets the CSS-compatible representation of this media feature. Java notation disallows "-" symbols, so the mixed-case enumeration values must be converted to CSS representation using this method.
        Returns:
        the CSS-compatible representation, such as "device-width".
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        toMinFeature(), toMaxFeature()

      • allowsMinMaxPrefix

        public boolean allowsMinMaxPrefix()
        Indicates if this media feature allows a "min-" and "max-" prefix.
        Returns:
        true if the prefix is allowed, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        toMinFeature(), toMaxFeature()

      • toMinFeature

        public String toMinFeature()
        Gets the "min-" media feature variant for compatible features.
        Returns:
        the CSS-compatible representation, such as "min-device-width".
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this feature is not compatible with the "min-" prefix.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        toFeature(), MIN_PREFIX

      • toMaxFeature

        public String toMaxFeature()
        Gets the "max-" media feature variant for compatible features.
        Returns:
        the CSS-compatible representation, such as "max-device-width".
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this feature is not compatible with the "max-" prefix.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        toFeature(), MAX_PREFIX
